creator: rnewman@thecia.net
text:
I want Tomcat to allow symbolic links for all of my web applications.   I put this into my server.xml, 
but Tomcat appears to ignore it entirely:

        <DefaultContext reloadable="true">
          <Resources className="org.apache.naming.resources.FileDirContext"
             allowLinking="true" />
        </DefaultContext> 

Adding that same <Resources> entry to individual <Context> elements works, but I shouldn't 
have to name all of my contexts individually in order to globally allow symbolic linking.

This is especially important since it seems that when I use allowLinking the
normal way, in an actual <Context> element, I can no longer undeploy that webapp
with the /manager servlet; Tomcat actually throws a NullPointerException. Here's
some of the trace:
2004-05-06 21:38:57 Manager: ManagerServlet.remove[/mywebapp]
java.io.IOException: java.lang.NullPointerException
        at
org.apache.catalina.core.StandardHostDeployer.remove(StandardHostDeployer.java:595)

Somebody? Anybody?
creator: dan@danamis.com
dan@danamis.com
text:
I just noticed this bug marked MacOS. I'm getting this error on Linux (Fedora
Core 1), Tomcat 4.1.30, and Sun JDK 1.4.2_04.

creator: markt@apache.org
text:
The DefaultContext docs are quite clear that DefaultContext only supports a
subset of Context configuration parameters.

I agree that this would be a useful feature but this is an enhancement request
rather than a bug. As ever, proposed patches are always welcome.
StandardDefaultContext has been removed from all currently supported Tomcat versions (5.5.x onwards)
